modules.description: This module provides a token type `t` that serves as a runtime indicator that Lwt_eio has been initialized. It is used by libraries to enforce that Lwt_eio is running before certain operations are performed, particularly when constructing configuration values or invoking entry points that depend on Lwt_eio's execution context. The token is abstract and cannot be directly created or manipulated, ensuring it is only obtained through valid initialization.

This module bridges Lwt and Eio by allowing bidirectional waiting on promises. It provides functions to convert Lwt threads into Eio-compatible blocking points and vice versa, enabling interoperability between the two concurrency systems. Use cases include integrating Lwt-based libraries into Eio applications and coordinating asynchronous operations across both frameworks.

This module enables seamless interoperability between Lwt and Eio concurrency systems through bidirectional promise conversion and event loop management. It provides functions to run Lwt code within Eio and vice versa, along with a token-based mechanism to enforce runtime initialization constraints. Concrete use cases include integrating Lwt-based libraries into Eio applications and coordinating asynchronous operations between the two frameworks.
